1.text: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than a house full of feasting [with] strife.

2.text: A wise servant shall rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.

3.text: The fining-pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but Jehovah trieth the hearts.

4.text: The evil-doer giveth heed to iniquitous lips; the liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.

5.text: Whoso mocketh a poor [man] reproacheth his Maker; he that is glad at calamity shall not be held innocent.

6.text: Childrenâ€™s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

7.text: Excellent speech becometh not a vile [man]; how much less do lying lips a noble!

8.text: A gift is a precious stone in the eyes of the possessor: whithersoever it turneth it prospereth.

9.text: He that covereth transgression seeketh love; but he that bringeth a matter up again separateth very friends.

10.text: A reproof entereth more deeply into him that hath understanding than a hundred stripes into a fool.

11.text: An evil [man] seeketh only rebellion; but a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man rather than a fool in his folly.

13.text: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of contention is [as] when one letteth out water; therefore leave off strife before it become vehement.

15.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, even they both are abomination to Jehovah.

16.text: To what purpose is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing [he] hath no sense?

17.text: The friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

18.text: A senseless man striketh hands, becoming surety for his neighbour.

19.text: He loveth transgression that loveth a quarrel; he that maketh high his gate seeketh destruction.

20.text: He that hath a perverse heart findeth no good; and he that shifteth about with his tongue falleth into evil.

21.text: He that begetteth a fool [doeth it] to his sorrow, and the father of a vile [man] hath no joy.

22.text: A joyful heart promoteth healing; but a broken spirit drieth up the bones.

23.text: A wicked [man] taketh a gift out of the bosom, to pervert the paths of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.

26.text: To punish a righteous [man] is not good, nor to strike nobles because of [their] uprightness.

27.text: He that hath knowledge spareth his words; and a man of understanding is of a cool spirit.

28.text: Even a fool when he holdeth his peace is reckoned wise, [and] he that shutteth his lips, intelligent.
